item.title: Google Dorks
item.description:
What Is Google Dorks? It is basically an advanced google search!

I have included four types of google dorks in this collection: Google dorks for SQL injection, Google dorks for Local File Inclusion, Google dorks For open CCTV cams and Google dorks for sensitive information.

Copy and paste the below google dorks on the search engine and have fun!

Google Dorks For SQL Injection:

•inurl:index.php?id=

•inurl:trainers.php?id=

•inurl:buy.php?category=

•inurl:article.php?ID=

•inurl:play_old.php?id=

•inurl:declaration_more.php?decl_id=

item.title: Reverse
item.description:
Reversing : N.B. The stack “grows” down to lower memory addresses!

ebp/rbp contains the address of the top of the current stack frame

esp/rsp contains address of bottom of the current stack frame

item.title: CTF New
item.description:
CTF New attacks and tools:

Hash extender attack: https://github.com/iagox86/hash%5Fextender

Decrypt substitution cipher using guesses: https://quipqiup.com/

Xor cipher: python3 -m pip install –user xortool

examples: xortool file.bin xortool -l 11 -c 20 file.bin xortool -x -c ’ ’ file.hex xortool -b -f -l 23 -t base64 message.enc

The most common use is to pass just the encrypted file and the most frequent character (usually 00 for binaries and 20 for text files) - length will be automatically chosen:

item.title: CTF Resource
item.description:
CTFs

Crackstation.net : NTLM, md4, md5 hashes match with existing hashtable from crackstation

Some useful commands:

  1. cat | head -n <line_number> | tail -1 : get n’th line_number

  2. strings reversing1 | egrep “^([A-Za-z0-9+/]{4})*([A-Za-z0-9+/]{2}==|[A-Za-z0-9+/]{3}=|[A-Za-z0-9+/]{4})$” | while read line ; do echo $line | base64 -d | cat -v && echo “”; done

    base64 encoded text regex

  3. echo “obase=16; <decimal_number>” | BC_LINE_LENGTH=0 bc | awk ‘{ print (length($0) % 2 == 0) ? $0 : 0$0; }’ : decimal number to zero padded hex
